results.title: 1980s Australian TV miniature
results.credit_line: Designed by Graham McGuffie, Emily Boutard and Megafun
results.brief_description: This gorgeous miniature model celebrates the evolving design of rooms where Australians watch TV, as well as the most memorable shows from the 1980s.

constellations_primary.name: Australian TV in the 1980s
constellations_primary.description: Australian television in the 80s really began to find its footing with mainstream hits becoming landmarks of the industry.

results.description: Neighbours, everybody needs good neighbours. But it didn’t start out that way, with the now iconic Australian soap first debuting to low ratings on Channel 7 in 1985. Following its cancellation, Channel 10 snapped up the rights and took a more a youthful approach with new cast members Jason Donovan, Guy Pearce and Kylie Minogue. Neighbours creator Reg Watson had another hit with Sons and Daughters, which was modelled off prime-time soaps in the US. One of Australia’s first reality programs, Perfect Match, also debuted in 1984, featuring dating-show robot Dexter who mathematically matched contestants with a compatibility score.
description_for_label: Neighbours, everybody needs good neighbours. But it didn’t start out that way, with the now iconic Australian soap first debuting to low ratings on Channel 7 in 1985. Following its cancellation, Channel 10 snapped up the rights and took a more a youthful approach with new cast members Jason Donovan, Guy Pearce and Kylie Minogue. Neighbours creator Reg Watson had another hit with Sons and Daughters, which was modelled off prime-time soaps in the US. One of Australia’s first reality programs, Perfect Match, also debuted in 1984, featuring dating-show robot Dexter who mathematically matched contestants with a compatibility score.

group_works.title: [Various women's athletic events from the 1976 Olympic Games]

results.title: 1976 kayak canoe Olympics. No. 13
results.brief_description: Part thirteen of a series which record the last three days of heats, repercharges and semi-finals of the 1976 Olympic Canoe and Kayak races in Montreal, 1976. Excellent for stroke analysis and coaching, as it includes slow motion close-ups of the best paddlers in the world. The 500m and 1000m finals are shown. Photographed by Dr. Stan Plagenhoef.

results.title: 1975: War of the flea: 1979: god fights back: 1989: people power: 1997: fast forward
results.creator_credit: Archie Baron, Angus MacQueen, Ben Loeterman, Dominic Ozanne, Bill Treharne Jones, WGBH (Boston) and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “People’s century: 1900-1999”.
This tape contains episodes twenty three to twenty six of the ‘People’s century 1900-1999’ series. 1975: WAR OF THE FLEA; success by guerilla fighters in Cuba, Vietnam and Afghanistan are used to illustrate how minority groups were able to overthrown government authorities, and are united by their religious idealogy and the uneasy peace that followed their actions. Narrated by Sean Barrett. 1979: GOD FIGHTS BACK; the secular liberalism of many Middle Eastern, African and Asian countries is rejected as the Ayatollah Khomeini’s Iranian revolution inspires Muslims to seek fundamentalist Islamic governments. Narrated by Sean Barrett. 1989: PEOPLE POWER; from the 1980 strike in Poland’s Gdansk Shipyard to the army’s attempt to lay siege to the Russian White House, eyewitnesses from an historic era recall the fall of the Eastern Bloc. Narrated by Veronika Hyks. 1997: FAST FORWARD; the collapse of Communism and the end of the Cold War heralds a new era of global capitalism. It also brought with it a bloody price, as resurging nationalism and old animosity brought forward ethnic violence, and an increasing divide between rich and poor brought social unrest. What will the twenty first century bring? Narrated by Sean Barrett.
